urls.title: Reflections on UK rivers and aquatic ecosystems
urls.description: A University of Bath Institute for Policy Research (IPR) online event

tweets.text:
Next month 📢

Join us for 'Reflections on UK rivers and aquatic ecosystems' 💧 Featuring panellists from @wessexwater, @EnvAgency, @nationaltrust, and @NaturalEngland.

🗓️ 3 Feb
🕐 6.00pm
💻 Online

Register now https://t.co/ytlBUnfeRp 🎟️⤵️
Re pollution of river Yare at UEA. environment agency has been aware and acted, but the pollution flows around these defences. The source need to be found and stopped https://t.co/AVEtXGyOuL

@NorthsideDan @jenny_truman @EnvAgency @myworcester Dredge was pretty much there all year (from memory) and we still had floods. Getting the double decker bus (we had those then!) With flood waters splashing up to top floor was a highlight of a trip into town. Ah 70's and no health and safety

Our teams have been out in #Cheshire today & found two farmers had recently spread organic manure. 

This is a potential breach of the Farming Rules for Water & Nitrate Vulnerable Zone Regs & poses a pollution risk to surface & ground waters. Appropriate action will now be taken. https://t.co/apPRR8RGbH

tweets.text: @jenny_truman @NorthsideDan @EnvAgency @myworcester Sure it was connected to stopping dredging which damaged river bed and had made it lifeless.

@urbanonetwork @jenny_truman @EnvAgency @myworcester That’s interesting Mark. Dredging must have caused all sorts of problems. With the flooding over recent years I have heard people calling for a return. Let’s hope not.

Apply now: https://t.co/qatD7dFz4V https://t.co/997TVlnQOZ

@urbanonetwork @NorthsideDan @EnvAgency @myworcester That is awful .  I adore the majestic swans Swimming along the river (and occasionally flying ) I didn’t know they ‘returned ‘ to Worcester in the 70s so thanks for that info .

tweets.text: Report odours to the Environment Agency @EnvAgencyMids on Tel: 0800 80 70 60 email: enquiries_westmids@environment-agency.gov.uk https://t.co/MpWr6oWY71

WALLEY'S QUARRY

I received a huge number of complaints about odour in the area last night and met with Councillor @SimonTagg today to discuss this.

We need to see more action on this from @EnvAgencyMids this year - please report all instances of odour to them on 0800 80 70 60. https://t.co/iQlMlIsJvu

@NaturalEngland @natural_course @DefraNature @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW @Lancswildlife @CheshireWT @cumbriawildlife @CIEEMnet We @saveferriby2020 could really do with some support to save Melton Fields, just 500m away from the Humber SSSI RAMSAR from developers building a huge distribution centre and concrete roads for HGVs. Curlew and other birds currently use the field to forage and roost.

urls.title: Planners give green light to Otter Valley project
urls.description: A project to help a river valley adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve now has planning permission.

tweets.text:
Our plan to restore the floodplain of the lower River Otter on England’s Jurassic Coast has been approved by @eastdevon.

Work will start soon to help the valley adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve.

Read more: https://t.co/IrOjgPdF1f

tweets.text: @NorthsideDan @jenny_truman @EnvAgency @myworcester Sure I read 60 of Worcester swans (out of 300) have died recently of bird flu. Seems deadly and contagious. I still remember when the first swans returned to Worcester in the 70s. Would hate to see this beautiful bird lost to the city again.
@JorvikAngler @YorksWildlife @YorkDalesRT @Jack_Hirst3 @EnvAgencyYNE @YISF__INNS @WildTroutTrust New year resolution....  Try to look for positives. Early days eh?

A landscape-scale project to address the impact of climate change and safeguard a much-loved amenity by returning a Devon estuary and flood plain to a more natural condition, has been given unanimous approval by East Devon District Council planning committee. [1/4] https://t.co/TDIZ5scjuD

tweets.text: @EnvAgency I’ve been reporting this for 4 years. I have a list of incident numbers. The EA do nothing about it. I’m not the only one.

.@EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia ... are you aware of this in incident reported by colleague Dr Barr? If so, can we have an update, please? If these fragile habitats are polluted, it can cause irreparable damage.

@MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC https://t.co/t44aiheITr

Living near to a landfill owned by @RedIndustries2 The @EnvAgency are in denial that the local residents of Newcastle-under-Lyme are suffering.The gases are trapped in my house.I have bought my own equipment to monitor the quality of air in my home and I am shocked at the results https://t.co/fsHxX8vPYM

@jenny_truman @EnvAgency @myworcester It is Jenny. Hopefully it’s not bird flu & just natural causes. I’m afraid with the way things are at the moment the body could be there for a few days more. On a positive note the Goosanders were looking great. Take care.
There’s more...@WUFoundation @EnvAgency @NatResWales https://t.co/IVFP8fdsJE

The creation of Medmerry wetlands has ensured a more resilience and sustainable coastline to the east of Bracklesham. Housing close to the coast prevents such an approach to the west of Medmerry. The danger of the shingle bank being breached will worsen in future years.
